title: Murder investigation as 39 bodies found inside lorry container in Essex
text:
A murder investigation has been launched after 39 bodies were discovered in a lorry container in Essex.

Essex Police were called to Waterglade Industrial Park in Grays, at about 1.40am Wednesday morning and found the bodies in the vehicle. It is understood 38 were adults and one was a teenager.

The driver - a 25-year-old-man from Northern Ireland - has been arrested on suspicion of murder.

It is understood the lorry was registered in Bulgaria and had entered the UK on Saturday at Holyhead - more than 300 miles from where the bodies were discovered near Thurrock.

Holyhead is the second-busiest ferry port in the UK after Dover, and serves as a major route from Ireland to mainland Britain.

Police are expected to provide an update on the latest developments on Wednesday morning, and although the force has not confirmed the bodies found were migrants, local MP Jackie Doyle-Price linked the deaths to people trafficking.

The Conservative MP for Thurrock wrote on Twitter: "Sickening news of 39 people found dead in a container in Grays. People trafficking is a vile and dangerous business. This is a big investigation for Essex Police."

Richard Burnett, chief executive of the Road Haulage Society, said: "This tragedy it highlights the danger of migrant gangs people smuggling on lorries."
description: A murder investigation has been launched after 39 bodies were discovered in a lorry container in Essex.
